alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued May 21 at 1:42PM MDT until May 22 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 expected. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, Central Carbon County, North Snowy Range Foothills, Southwest Carbon County, Upper North Platte River Basin, Laramie Valley, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
